name: bitchily
content:

in an unkind or unpleasant way, especially when this involves saying cruel things about people: Critics wrote bitchily about his performance in the movie, declaring that his career was probably over. He is always talkative, gossipy, and bitchily entertaining. Related words
bitchy
bitch
More examplesFewer examplesThe newspaper gossip columnist is notorious for commenting bitchily on celebrities' style choices. She never worried about hurting people's feelings, and relished being bitchily honest.Her favourite reality TV show is about wealthy housewives who act bitchily toward each other. He bitchily asked whether she had just woken up or whether her hair had been styled that way.
